title: Riemannian optimization for non-centered mixture of scaled Gaussian distributions. (arXiv:2209.03315v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper studies the statistical model of the non-centered mixture of scaled Gaussian distributions (NC-MSG). Using the Fisher-Rao information geometry associated to this distribution, we derive a Riemannian gradient descent algorithm. This algorithm is leveraged for two minimization problems. The first one is the minimization of a regularized negative log-likelihood (NLL). The latter makes the trade-off between a white Gaussian distribution and the NC-MSG. Conditions on the regularization are given so that the existence of a minimum to this problem is guaranteed without assumptions on the samples. Then, the Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence between two NC-MSG is derived. This divergence enables us to define a minimization problem to compute centers of mass of several NC-MSGs. tldr: 本文研究了非中心化缩放高斯分布的统计模型，并提出了基于黎曼优化的梯度下降算法，用于解决最小化问题，包括正则化负对数似然和计算若干个NC-MSG的质心。实验证明该算法具有良好性能和速度。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a Riemannian gradient descent algorithm based on the Fisher-Rao information geometry for the non-centered mixture of scaled Gaussian distributions (NC-MSG). It solves two minimization problems, i.e., regularized negative log-likelihood and computing centers of mass for multiple NC-MSGs. Experimental results show that the proposed algorithm has good performance and speed.
